UI_visible_response: Read 26 web pagesView Page Details“Wolf Warrior Diplomacy” is a more assertive and confrontational form of public diplomacy adopted by some Chinese diplomats in the late 2010s. It is characterized by aggressive rhetoric, public confrontations, and a willingness to push back against perceived slights and criticism. This shift in diplomatic strategy is named after the popular Chinese action film series “Wolf Warrior,” where Chinese special forces battle foreign adversaries.Origins and DevelopmentThe rise of wolf warrior diplomacy can be traced back to several factors:Nationalism: Rapid economic development and China’s emergence as a global power have fostered a strong sense of national pride among its citizens. Rising nationalism has put pressure on Chinese leaders to adopt a more assertive stance in defending the country’s interests on the international stage.Perception of External Threats: Chinese leaders perceived an increasingly hostile international environment, particularly from the United States, which they believed threatened the rule of the Chinese Communist Party (CCP).
